metadata.description: The location in Microsoft Azure where these resources should be created.
The uri to download the depot from as currently stored in Azure Blob Store

Specify whether to create a new or existing virtual network for the VMs.  If using an existing virtual network it must have subnets: GatewaySubnet, AzureBastionSubnet, computeSubnet, midtierSubnet, metadataSubnet, and jumpSubnet.
Name of the resource group if using an existing Virtual Network, leave blank if creating a new Virtual Network.
Allow administrative access from this IP or CIDR block. Default value of 0.0.0.0/0 allows management from the entire Internet
Allow http/https access from this IP or CIDR block. Default value of 0.0.0.0/0 allows access from the entire Internet
For a standard deployment, leave empty. If you are running from a blob template, then provide the Shared Access Signature token (starting with a ?) that grants authorization to the private template.

For a standard deployment, keep the default.  The https URL to the base of the deployment files in Microsoft Azure. If a SAS key is needed, please do not include the SAS key in the URL. Instead, add the part after and include the question mark to the _artifactsLocationSasToken variable. ex. https://(STORAGE_ACCOUNT).file.core.windows.net/(SHARE_NAME)/(SUBDIRECTORY_NAME)/

variables.vnetResourceGroup: [if(equals(parameters('Use a New or Existing Virtual Network?'),'New'),resourceGroup().name,parameters('Existing Virtual Network Resource Group'))]

variables.useNewNetwork: [equals(parameters('Use a New or Existing Virtual Network?'), 'New')]
